heading: Tyre will be overthrown.
verses: IE a message of doom to the Phoenician city, Tyre.
. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish; for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in: from the land of
IE Cyprus. Refugees tell of destruction.
, ye inhabitants of the isle; thou whom the merchants of Zidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.
her revenue; and she is a mart of nations.
of the sea, saying, I travail not, nor bring forth children, neither do I nourish up young men,
OR When the report is heard by Egypt.
shall they be sorely pained at the report of Tyre.
Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the isle.
of ancient days? her own feet shall carry her afar off to sojourn.
Who hath taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning
of hosts hath purposed it, to stain the pride of all glory,
to bring into contempt all the honourable of the earth.
Pass through thy land as a river, O daughter of Tarshish:
He stretched out his hand over the sea, he shook the kingdoms: the
to destroy the strong holds thereof.
And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed virgin, daughter of Zidon: arise, pass over to Chittim; there also shalt thou have no rest.
the Assyrian founded it for them that dwell in the wilderness: they set up the towers thereof, they raised up the palaces thereof;
Howl, ye ships of Tarshish: for your strength is laid waste.
And it shall come to pass in that day, that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, according to the days
of one king: after the end of seventy years shall Tyre sing as an harlot.
Take an harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been forgotten; make sweet melody, sing many songs, that thou mayest be remembered.
And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that the
will visit Tyre, and she shall
to her hire, and shall commit
with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth.
IE Any success she has will only be as permitted by the Lord.
: it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the
, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.
